jade.core.behaviours
Class SequentialPriorityBehaviour

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour
      jade.core.behaviours.CompositeBehaviour
          jade.core.behaviours.SerialBehaviour
              jade.core.behaviours.SequentialPriorityBehaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SequentialPriorityBehaviour
extends jade.core.behaviours.SerialBehaviour

Composite behaviour with priority-based children scheduling. It is a CompositeBehaviour that executes its children behaviours in sequential form, using first their priorities to establish the sequence and, if two behaviours have the same priority, the order in which they have been added.

Also this CompositeBehaviour allows two variants: skip the blocked behaviours and without skipping them (default behaviour).

Roughly speaking, the scheduler runs as follows:

  1. If there are no children behaviours then this CompositeBehaviour is done.
  2. Always pick the behaviour with the highest priority, that is, the behaviour who priority is the lesser. If two or more behaviours have the highest priority, then select the one that has been created first.
  3. If the previously selected behaviour is blocked, and this CompositeBehaviour is configured to skip the blocked behaviours, then skip this behaviour and go again to step 2.
  4. If there are not any runnable behaviour (i.e., all the children is blocked), then block this behaviour.
  5. If the selected behaviour is blocked and this CompositeBehaviour does not skip the blocked behaviours, then block this composite behaviour.
  6. In other case execute this behaviour and go to step 1.

DEFAULT_PRIORITY

public static final int DEFAULT_PRIORITY
The default priority for the newly created behaviours, if none is specified.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SequentialPriorityBehaviour

public SequentialPriorityBehaviour()
Default constructor. Creates a CompositeBehaviour without setting the owner agent, and executes its children in a priority-based sequentially manner, and it terminates when all children are done. It always selects the child with the highest priority.

SequentialPriorityBehaviour

public SequentialPriorityBehaviour(jade.core.Agent a)
Creates a SequentialPriorityBehaviour setting the owner agent. It always selects the child with the highest priority.

Parameters:
a - the owner of this behaviour

SequentialPriorityBehaviour

public SequentialPriorityBehaviour(jade.core.Agent a,
                                   boolean skipBlocked)
Creates a SequentialPriorityBehaviour setting the owner agent.

Parameters:
a - the owner of this behaviour
skipBlocked - true if it is always selected the child with the highest priority that is runnable, or false if it is always selected the child with the highest priority, whether it is runnable or not

SequentialPriorityBehaviour

public SequentialPriorityBehaviour(boolean skipBlocked)
Creates a SequentialPriorityBehaviour.

Parameters:
skipBlocked - true if it is always selected the child with the highest priority that is runnable, or false if it is always selected the child with the highest priority, whether it is runnable or not

addSubBehaviour

public void addSubBehaviour(jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour b,
                            int priority)
Adds a priority behaviour to this SequentialPriorityBehaviour.

Parameters:
b - the behaviour to be added
priority - the priority of the behaviour. If it is less than 0 then it is changed to 0.

changePriority

                           int newPriority)
Changes the priority of a behaviour.

Parameters:
b - the behaviour which priority is to be changed
newPriority - the new priority of the behaviour. If it less than 0 then uses 0.
